title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: It’s so hot in the western U.S. that some people are ‘wobbling’ and collapsing to the ground as they walk outside
items.description: About 1.2 million people were under extreme heat risk, meaning temperatures were expected to stay dangerously high with no relief overnight.

items.title: The last ‘ace’: World War II fighter pilot Donald McPherson, who shot down 5 enemy planes, dies at 103
items.description: McPherson was listed as the conflict's last living U.S. ace by both the American Fighter Aces Association and the Fagen Fighters WWII Museum.

items.title: Crews Rescue Two Women Stuck in Hot Tub at Remote Cabin
items.description: Health issues prevented the women, who were in their 80s, from climbing out, officials said. They became unresponsive after overheating and developing...

items.title: The Shawn Kemp sentence: He says his truck and cellphone were stolen and he returned fire at the thieves. Nobody was hurt but he’s under electronic home monitoring
items.description: The former NBA star looked at the ceiling and blew a huff of air when he heard his sentence, which also includes 240 hours of community service.

items.title: Why Haven’t Sanctions on Russia Stopped the War? The Money Is Still Flowing.
items.description: For decades, companies feared being on the wrong side of U.S. sanctions. That’s not always true anymore.

items.title: ‘A bit of a shock’: Even community colleges, largely nonpartisan commuter schools, are feeling the Trump education crackdown
items.description: A professor in Colorado said that at his school, you don't typically see "the kind of unrest and polarization that you see at other campuses.”

items.title: The Federal Reserve could start resembling the Supreme Court
items.description: Fed governors typically step down before their terms expire, but they may stay on until a president from their political party is in the White House.

items.title: As Other Israelis Die in War, Ultra-Orthodox Resist Call to Fight
items.description: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis, exempt for decades from military service, are now being drafted. Their rage is dividing Israel and threatening Prime Minister...

items.title: Revealing Taste
items.description: A clever leak exposed the music habits of some famous people — and two Times journalists.

items.title: Zelensky Marks Ukraine’s Independence Day With Diplomacy in Kyiv and a Plea for Peace
items.description: The Ukrainian leader held talks with Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada and was set to meet with President Trump’s envoy, Keith Kellogg, amid contin...

items.title: Peace Talks in Ukraine All Lead to the Donbas
items.description: The contested region is where Russia’s war in Ukraine began a decade ago. Scores of Ukrainian soldiers have died defending it. Would Ukraine give it u...
